f7b5b9b9-2632-4ecc-9685-4e420ba701ef.description: Earners understand, recognize the importance of and model best practices in customer service to promote success in on-campus positions. They will be able to: define and recognize the importance of customer service; identify customers and their expectations in a professional setting; identify and commit to Pace's Service Values and Standards; build communication skills; use service driven expressions; understand how mindset can impact service delivery; assist with difficult customer situations.
f7b5b9b9-2632-4ecc-9685-4e420ba701ef.name: Customer Service Program for Students

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of 3 synchronous online modules with activities; each module is 90 minutes. Module 1: Service Values; Module 2: Customer Service Communication; Module 3: The Service Mindset

5dc0754c-edd6-48a1-82d5-04a8f7d90db9.description: Earners of the INSPIRE (International Student Professional Readiness Education) Program certification have developed the career readiness competencies to gain entry to pre-professional and professional roles. The badge offers tools to identify career goals and develop plans for reaching them, gain awareness of strengths and areas for development, build professional relationships, self-advocate effectively, and seek opportunities to build skills for supporting a successful career trajectory.
5dc0754c-edd6-48a1-82d5-04a8f7d90db9.name: INSPIRE (International Student Professional Readiness Education) Program Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a 6-module career education program, including a choice of synchronous or asynchronous materials. Modules Include: Explore and Join a Career Community, Rock Your Resume, International Student Guide to Gaining Experience in the US, LinkedIn & Handshake Profiles, Pitch & Interviewing, Search for Internships & Jobs

Complete 6 Assessments, including: Join a Career Community using the Handshake tool, Use Resume Worded tool to scan and revise the resume, with a minimum score of 65, Complete case-based quiz, Use Resume Worded tool to optimize LinkedIn profile, Use Resume Worded tool to target the resume to a job description, Complete mock interview using Big Interview tool

44c3f058-478c-4160-97f0-051cf91e6b54.description: This badge indicates that the holder has shown competence in a desktop-based Geographic Information System (GIS). They can locate geographic-based data, create new data and produce quality maps and videos that are self-explanatory, effectively-symbolized and shareable.
44c3f058-478c-4160-97f0-051cf91e6b54.name: Desktop GIS

badge_template_activities.title: Created a portfolio of maps, videos and packages in a Desktop GIS course.

7907de16-636c-47c2-a266-439c5e480cc5.description: This badge allows the student to understand the basic concepts of telecommunications in our ever-changing world. Understanding how broadband communications transmit and receive data allows the badge earner to diagnose and repair relatively simple problems with communication, both wired and wireless, The badge also gives the earner the ability to increase their productivity through the use of the Microsoft Office Applications of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access.
7907de16-636c-47c2-a266-439c5e480cc5.name: Telecom Essentials

alignments.name: Completion Grade
alignments.description: Must successfully complete each of the courses in this badge with a grade of a C or higher

badge_template_activities.title: Complete AIT 109 Broadband Essentials
Complete AIT 107 Computer Applications for Telecom

skills.name: Integrating And Monitoring Wired And Wireless Networks

3c8f59d9-7bc8-433e-8f79-9f9b48dc4fc3.description: Earner of the Construction Project Management certification have developed the entry-level knowledge and skills needed for a construction-oriented profession. They are competent in skills such as project cost estimation, project scheduling, and managing key business concepts in the field of construction.
3c8f59d9-7bc8-433e-8f79-9f9b48dc4fc3.name: Construction Project Management Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Construction Project Management Continuing Education course
Complete the requirements for the Construction Project Management Certification

c4f78f4c-b4bb-4c85-a444-65b86b2c7e7d.description: The earner of this badge will demonstrate foundational mathematical, electrical circuit, and computer system skills. The earner will be able to measure and calculate voltages, currents, and resistance for electrical circuits, identify key components determine their purpose, and troubleshoot computer and information systems, and demonstrate the mathematical foundation necessary for continued study in the field. (Requires Essentials Badge)
c4f78f4c-b4bb-4c85-a444-65b86b2c7e7d.name: Telecom Core

alignments.name: Completion Grade
alignments.description: Must successfully complete each of the courses in this badge with a grade of a C or higher

badge_template_activities.title: Complete MAT 125 Technical Mathematics
Complete AIT 111 AC/DC Electrical Circuits
Complete CIT 211 Introduction to Computer Systems
Telecom Essentials

8fe8bd97-89ac-4d62-ad0e-6af06b9ca212.description: The badge earner will understand how to design and deploy Internet Protocol-based networks for voice and data, understand technologies now emerging in the industry, and security concerns surrounding these new technologies. The earner will have a firm grasp on the concepts of fiber-optic based networks and will understand how to implement them from one endpoint to another. Must select three of the four courses listed below.
8fe8bd97-89ac-4d62-ad0e-6af06b9ca212.name: Telecom Technologies

alignments.name: Completion Grade
alignments.description: Must successfully complete each of the courses in this badge with a grade of a C or higher

badge_template_activities.title: Complete AIT371 Fiber Optics
Complete AIT381 Emerging Broadband Technologies
Complete AIT383 Emerging Wireless Technologies
Complete AIT382 Voice Over IP Technologies
Telecom Core

skills.name: Develop And Manage Internet Of Things - Cloud Service (IOTCS) Applications
Light Sources And Detectors For Fiber Based Networks

f9859296-c2aa-49a0-80c1-1d46e5a0a5ce.description: Earners of this badge will: learn about career resources offered to students and alumni, counseling techniques, assessment tests, data analysis methods, marketing to drive student participation, and ways to partner with employers; assist students and alumni with creating or updating resumes and job and internship searches; provide interview preparation and mock interviews; conduct career related workshops; work with student organizations to provide programming; research student placements.
f9859296-c2aa-49a0-80c1-1d46e5a0a5ce.name: Career Services Certification: Higher Education Career Preparation

alignments.name: Alignment to NACE Top Attributes Employers Want to See on Resumes

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Career Services Intern Training sessions.  Modules include: Exploring Values Interests, Personality, Skills; Resume Writing: Don’t Let a Resume be Eliminated by the Bots; Pitch Perfect: 30-Seconds of Personal Branding ; Uncover the Truth of Cover Letters (and thank you too!); Online Profiles; Jobs Search Strategies; Information Interviewing; Data Report for Career Services; Social Media and Career Services
Asynchronous, virtual training and assessment modules in Classes: INSPIRE Program overview; Rock Your Resume; CPT Guidelines; Winning Strategies for a Job Search; Ace Your Interview

Complete internship assignment with Career Services' Counseling Team.  Acquire real-world experience with students and recent alumni via 1:1 appointments , workshops, employer spotlights, panels, and career fairs. Acquire skills to understand data and goals, and career preparation strategies to drive student success.

skills.name: Ability To Work In A Team

92a3e612-c392-473d-8010-5cb34a7d8ac6.description: The badge earner will examine the impact of network security as it relates to voice, video, and data networks. Identify how cryptographic can be used including the various strengths and weaknesses of these algorithms and demonstrate how to design and construct network layouts as well as signify which network hardware will be required for the network to properly operate. The earner will also create a robust network security plan. (Requires Essentials Badge)
92a3e612-c392-473d-8010-5cb34a7d8ac6.name: IT Core

alignments.name: Completion Grade
alignments.description: Must successfully complete each of the courses in this badge with a grade of a C or higher

badge_template_activities.title: Complete CIT251 Computer Security Overview
Complete CIT 221 Global Networking Technology
Telecom Essentials

0dea9955-e5d2-4018-9628-b552e6e76a12.description: Earners of this badge are introduced to the histories of human rights, gender equality movements, feminist advocacy, and girls’ rights activism inside the United Nations across three sequential Women’s & Gender Studies courses. Students will experience first-hand the ways in which young people advance human rights priorities with world leaders and international actors during two key global events: International Day of the Girl (IDG) and the Commission on the Status of Women (CSW).
0dea9955-e5d2-4018-9628-b552e6e76a12.name: Human Rights Advocacy

badge_template_activities.title: WS 115C - Introduction to Women's & Gender Studies through Civic Engagement. This course can be waived if student has previously completed W115 or W166.
WS 297F - Geographies of Girlhood
WS 297X Gender and Human Rights

fe958ccc-d35c-477e-8ee8-915f190aca23.description: Social Justice & You is a 4-week online educational experience intended for undergraduate Pace University students to learn more about the practice of social justice hosted by Pace University's Division of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. Students build skills and knowledge focusing on the interconnectedness of diversity, equity, and inclusion through virtual workshops and discussions.
fe958ccc-d35c-477e-8ee8-915f190aca23.name: Social Justice & You

badge_template_activities.title: Students are required to attend four 90 minute sessions a week focused on the following content areas: Privilege, Race & Racism, LGBTQ+ issues & identities, Gender Equity, Food Insecurity, Oppression, and Allyship.

581a0776-d389-4003-bf98-85ec5ba7da48.description: Earners of the Seidenberg Scholars badge will learn programming and interactivity through the lens of Game Development. No prior experience is needed. Students will gain familiarity with the Unity game engine and learn about topics such as sprites, models, collisions, physics, lighting, and audio. Additionally, students will create their own behaviors through scripting in C#. This is a project-based course with students building playable games.
581a0776-d389-4003-bf98-85ec5ba7da48.name: Seidenberg Scholars - Game Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete two 2D games that fulfill the programming requirements of the class.
Present finished games as a team to the instructor.

skills.name: Game Objects And Components User Experience

af463cae-5bd7-49b6-b011-d330c88e0fb5.description: Earners of this badge will learn skills that enable them to react with thoughtful leadership and community-building skills in moments of crisis and disruption. Earners will form mentor partnerships and generate communities of care and support designed to provide guidance for moments of crisis and introduce them to one another, the University, and the NYC community. Earners will collaborate with faculty to design and implement social justice initiatives on campus and within downtown NYC.
af463cae-5bd7-49b6-b011-d330c88e0fb5.name: Peer to Peer Mentorship & Leadership Training Program - Mentee

badge_template_activities.title: WS 002b:  Crisis Leadership:  A Peer to Peer Mentoring Program to Create Community, Justice and Connection During the Pandemic

eb642241-81c7-4e62-a293-870eff6554ea.description: Earners of this badge will learn skills that enable them to react with thoughtful leadership and peer-mentoring skills in moments of crisis and disruption. Earners will form mentor partnerships and generate communities of care and support designed to provide guidance to first-year students for moments of crisis. Earners will collaborate with faculty to design and implement social justice initiatives on campus and within downtown NYC.
eb642241-81c7-4e62-a293-870eff6554ea.name: Peer to Peer Mentorship & Leadership Training Program - Mentor

badge_template_activities.title: WS 002a:  Crisis Leadership Mentor:  A Peer to Peer Mentoring Program to Create Community, Justice and Connection During the Pandemic

a3685d1e-0a38-41b2-855d-9a91122c57a4.description: This badge will be awarded to Pace employees that complete the required modules as listed in the Open Educational Resources (OER) Badging program. Earners of the Open Educational Resources Badge will demonstrate proficiency in defining and describing OER characteristics; describe methods on how OER can be used in teaching and learning; provide an understanding for OER Creative Commons (CC) licensing; and provide methods for the adoption and integration of OER materials into University courses.
a3685d1e-0a38-41b2-855d-9a91122c57a4.name: Open Educational Resources

badge_template_activities.title: Identifying, Finding, and Adopting OER: This module will consist of PDF documents and videos the faculty member will have to consult and then complete an assessment. Learning outcomes include: the difference between free-to-access, public domain, and open licensing rights; formats and types of OER; becoming familiar with OER search platforms; evaluating the quality or the OER.

Customizing and Integrating OER: This module will consist of PDF documents and videos the faculty member will have to consult and then complete an assessment. Learning outcomes include: How to edit an OER; Demonstrate how to integrate OER content from into a Learning Management System or other learning environment.

Creating, Licensing, and Publishing: This will consist of PDF documents and videos the faculty member will have to consult and then complete an assessment. Learning outcomes include: How to distinguish the various open licenses; Determine the appropriate license for OER needs; Applying a license to one's work; Become familiar with Pace's Digital Commons and other open repositories to determine publishing options.

faebdd68-f0a9-48d5-bd24-429ead4066ee.description: This badge is intended for undergraduate Pace University students to learn about the area of risk management and its significance within the areas of the criminal justice system. Special focus will be on social and political risks, and organizational difficulties in navigating and balancing critical issues and events within the system. Students will build their knowledge base on risk reduction and develop professional skills in one of the up-and-coming area of focus in criminal justice.
faebdd68-f0a9-48d5-bd24-429ead4066ee.name: Criminal Justice Risk Management

badge_template_activities.title: CRJ 297 – Special Topics - Social and Political Risks in Criminal Justice Agencies

3240f1d4-4341-4b12-8f55-f0ce8965fb36.description: Earners of the Career Development Program badge have completed a series of sessions focused on career awareness, personal and professional development, and career decision-making skills. They will complete an individualized strengths assessment, participate in career coaching, career development programs, and an independent career planning project.
3240f1d4-4341-4b12-8f55-f0ce8965fb36.name: Pace University Career Development Program

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Pace University Career Development Program
Present individual career plan project

6ee00a03-91b2-4424-94ea-beb8163abc9c.description: Earners of this badge have developed skills in basic legal writing, reading legal materials and oral communication skills commonly used in the practice of law. They are able to: produce accurate and appropriate written legal documents such as briefs, reports, and memos; extract key components of legal cases and texts, such as the rule of law, and produce reports, briefs, and memos; and identify legal reasoning in oral arguments and participate in discussions, presentations, and oral arguments.
6ee00a03-91b2-4424-94ea-beb8163abc9c.name: Professional Legal English Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Legal Writing:  After completing the 20-hour Legal Writing course, badge earners are able to organize their thoughts and ideas logically, concisely, and academically in outlines and drafts.  They are also able to write concise, clear legal documents.  They can effectively utilize research and extra-source information in legal writing, as well as effectively utilize paraphrasing, summarizing, and synthesis in writing and effectively utilize the writing process in developing and writing drafts.

Reading Legal Materials:  After successfully completing the 20-hour Reading Legal Materials course, badge earners are able to utilize reading strategies such a skimming and scanning and take organized and comprehensive notes on academic and technical legal texts.  They can comprehend and analyze academic and legal texts and utilize texts and references in research and in developing arguments and counterarguments.

Legal Listening and Speaking Skills: After successfully completing the 20-hour Legal Listening and Speaking Skills course, badge earners are able to use rational, clear, and organized speech and give information and persuasive presentation speeches in legal settings.  They can understand and respond to arguments with counterarguments and take effective and concise notes while listening to legal speeches or discussions.

87d7c6d7-d589-44b8-a720-cf57b1bb1339.description: Earners of the Seidenberg Scholars badge will have developed basic game development skills, including designing 2D games using software like Unity. They are familiar with sprites, tiles, collisions, game physics, audio, and creating your own behaviors through scripting in C#. This badge leads to three college credits which can be applied to your undergraduate degree at Pace University’s Seidenberg School.
87d7c6d7-d589-44b8-a720-cf57b1bb1339.name: Seidenberg Scholars - Game Development (Credit Bearing Badge)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete two 2D games that fulfill the programming requirements of the class.
Present finished games as a team to the instructor.

skills.name: Game Objects And Components User Experience

4490d9c7-6c1d-4034-b1e0-966f56d5f01b.description: Ed Media Customer Service Badge (Level I) Earners of this badge have acquired the basic soft skills and technical competence needed to effectively assist end-users and effectively communicate issues to full-time staff. They have entry-level skills in customer service, proper phone etiquette, over-the-phone troubleshooting (where applicable); familiarity with supporting classroom audio/visual equipment and instructional tools (Panopto, Zoom, Kahoot!); and navigating Windows and Mac computers.
4490d9c7-6c1d-4034-b1e0-966f56d5f01b.name: Customer Service Badge (Ed Media)

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate completion and/or mastery of all requirements, including customer service student program modules 1 and 2.
Demonstrates a full understanding departmental and office processes and procedures.
Minimum of at least 150 documented hours of work experience (or 1 completed semester).

44853fc2-f531-4dca-ae47-183020c15b8a.description: Earners of the IT Service Desk Student Technician Proficiency I (Level 1) badge have developed entry-level skills and competence in customer service, proper phone etiquette, basic troubleshooting techniques, performing password resets, familiarity with navigating Windows, Mac, and mobile operating systems, assisting with wireless and email account setups, remote assistance technologies, help desk ticket creation/lookup/management/resolution, proper issue escalation, and more.
44853fc2-f531-4dca-ae47-183020c15b8a.name: IT Service Desk Student Technician Proficiency I

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate completion and/or mastery of all requirements, including customer service student program modules 1 and 2.
Minimum of 150 documented hours of on-the-job experience.

9edd276b-55ab-409c-a6eb-9079b30a4fb4.description: Earners of the Pace Votes Leadership Certificate have developed leadership skills related to communication, organizing, collaboration, and advocacy by engaging in voter education campaigns and exploring themes of civic engagement, social justice, and anti-racism. They have worked collaboratively with peers, staff/faculty, and community partners to develop and apply these leadership skills.
9edd276b-55ab-409c-a6eb-9079b30a4fb4.name: Pace Votes Leadership Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Participation in monthly trainings hosted by CCAR on topics of civic leadership and social justice.
Participation in 3 hours of voter education work a month, which includes tabling, course presentations, and educational events.
Development, implementation, and assessment of a student-led advocacy campaign that implements engagement tactics discussed in leadership trainings.

d81bc5c2-ca65-419d-a31c-28a4cffb8eea.description: Earners will gain: mastery of the collection process, analysis and reporting of student and recent graduate outcomes; understanding of how Operations units assemble data for report generation; insight in supporting Planning, Assessment, and Institutional Research in a University; competence in collecting and organizing data with a focus on quality assurance and verification; skill in project management, delegation, program assessment, and identifying learning outcomes.
d81bc5c2-ca65-419d-a31c-28a4cffb8eea.name: Career Services Certification: Higher Education Operations

alignments.name: Alignment to Pace Career Serives Mission Statement
Alignment to NACE Top Attributes Employers Want to See on Resumes

badge_template_activities.title: Career Services Intern Training sessions. Modules include: Synchronous virtual training modules in Zoom; Exploring Values Interests, Personality, Skills; Resume Writing: Don’t Let a Resume be Eliminated by the Bots; Pitch Perfect: 30-Seconds of Personal Branding; Uncover the Truth of Cover Letters (and thank you too!); Online Profiles; Jobs Search Strategies; Information Interviewing; Data Report for Career Services ; Social Media and Career Services
Asynchronous, virtual training and assessment modules in Classes/Brightspace: INSPIRE Program overview; Rock Your Resume; CPT Guidelines; Winning Strategies for a Job Search Assessment
Learning Outcome Training Data Analytics and Database Structure/Maintenance Training

Complete internship assignment with Career Services' Operations Team.  Acquire real-world experience in higher education operations and assessment through the lens of Career Services.  Acquire skills to understand data and utilize to drive student success.

skills.name: Ability To Work In A Team

e896eb08-f1bb-4394-813a-ab60ec7d8e07.description: Earners of this badge will be Career Services interns. Interns will: Meet weekly with Director Employer Relations for supervision and professional development; attend Employer Spotlights and Employer Relations meetings; participate in Career Fairs; support the logistics and facilitation of employers in Tech Troubleshooting Zoom Room; shadow supervisors on business development calls; pull daily jobs/internship reports to learn trends; prepare a weekly outreach list from contacts ("hot leads").
e896eb08-f1bb-4394-813a-ab60ec7d8e07.name: Career Services Certification: Higher Educaton Employer Relations

badge_template_activities.title: Synchronous and Asynchronous Modules: Exploring Values Interests, Personality, Skills; Resume Writing: Don’t Let a Resume be Eliminated by the Bots; Pitch Perfect: 30-Seconds of Personal Branding; Uncover the Truth of Cover Letters; Online Profiles; Jobs Search Strategies; Information Interviewing; Data Report for Career Services; Social Media and Career Services; INSPIRE Program overview; Rock Your Resume; CPT Guidelines; Winning Strategies for a Job Search; Ace Your Interview

skills.name: Ability To Work In A Team

963c03cd-d364-447c-8488-9a56854bcfe3.description: Earners of the IT Service Desk Student Technician Proficiency II (Level 2) badge have developed more mid-to-advanced tech support/troubleshooting expertise as well as coaching/training skills and have been applying them on the job consistently by helping to support/train/coach other junior-level service desk technicians.
963c03cd-d364-447c-8488-9a56854bcfe3.name: IT Service Desk Student Technician Proficiency II

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate completion and/or mastery of all requirements, including customer service student program module 3
Minimum of 300 documented hours of on-the-job experience, including performing a minimum of 100 hours of documented senior-level support tasks.
IT Service Desk Student Technician Proficiency I

skills.name: Coaching/Training/Support of Junior-Level Service Desk Technicians

13e90d27-7104-4245-bbdd-6a5b0318b72d.description: Earners of the Academic Technology Proficiency level 1 badge have developed entry-level skills in Brightspace and competence in customer support, proper phone etiquette, and basic troubleshooting techniques. These earners will display competency in the use of the ticketing system and with creating ‘how-to’ documentation within TDX.
13e90d27-7104-4245-bbdd-6a5b0318b72d.name: Academic Technology Proficiency level I

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates a full understanding departmental and office processes and procedures
Minimum of at least 150 documented hours of work experience (or 1 completed semester)
Customer service student program modules 1 and 2

85b47e0b-de24-46f7-b157-69d2ca9bc47d.description: Client Support Student Technician Proficiency I (Level I) staff can perform semi-advanced troubleshooting; install software and do basic hardware replacements; fix WiFi connectivity issues; properly distribute and decommission end-user laptops, desktops, and mobile devices; complete the computer preparation checklist; decommission a device securely (hard drive/RAM removal); properly record inventory changes for deployed/recycled devices; work autonomously; and go on field calls when assigned.
85b47e0b-de24-46f7-b157-69d2ca9bc47d.name: Client Support Student Technician Proficiency I

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of 20 Windows PCs fully imaged and prepped with no errors (A full-time technician does not have to redo any item of the checklist).
Demonstrates a full understanding of inventory process and record keeping (can properly report all asset information necessary to update University database.
Student can and has been sent on field calls without supervision to resolve software/hardware issues.
Must have accumulated at least 150 hours (2 semesters) of work experience.

c32389f8-cc6a-46e7-aa7f-028bc640add3.description: Client Support Student Technician Proficiency II (Level II) staff can work unsupervised and self-assign work tickets; complete University PC replacements from prep stage to end-user handover; complete task lists for data transfer, shared drives, Outlook, etc.; troubleshoot/resolve issues with operating system, hardware, peripherals (e.g. printers), and networking; demonstrate awareness of other ITS departments and roles and can escalate to the correct department if needed; train junior staff.
c32389f8-cc6a-46e7-aa7f-028bc640add3.name: Client Support Student Technician Proficiency II

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a minimum if 10 University Replacements unassisted and with no errors.

Have been delegated the responsibility of training a new hire and can successfully teach dept. processes related to Proficiency Level I: computer imaging, inventory updates, decommissioning machines, how to use Team Dynamix
Has established they are able to work autonomously. Work does not need to be delegated and technical skills are self-sufficient for majority of day-to-day operations.
Must have accumulated at least 300 hours (2 semesters) of work experience.
Client Support Student Technician Proficiency I

e7d28637-31a6-45fb-a0aa-bd36e076bc28.description: (Requires IT Core) Badge earners will be able to create and execute python scripts for a variety of projects both large and small. The earner will be able to design and develop databases using Microsoft Access and use SQL language or python programming language to access data. The earner will demonstrate the ability to conduct statistical analyses using Excel, interpret descriptive and inferential statistics, and explore relationships among variables.
e7d28637-31a6-45fb-a0aa-bd36e076bc28.name: Data Analytics

badge_template_activities.title: Complete CIT201 Introduction to Programming Using Python
Complete CIT241 Database Management
Complete MAT117 Elementary Statistics
Telecom Core

skills.name: Introduction to Python for Data Science

b694590c-6311-4778-9021-61cbd2735619.description: Earners of the IT Computer Lab Student Consultant Proficiency I (Level 1) badge have developed entry-level skills and competence in customer service, proper phone etiquette, and basic troubleshooting techniques. They are familiar with help desk ticketing tasks, printer support, familiarity with navigating Windows, Mac, and mobile operating systems, performing wireless and email account setups, proper issue escalation, basic functionality of installed lab software packages, and more.
b694590c-6311-4778-9021-61cbd2735619.name: IT Computer Lab Student Consultant Proficiency I

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate completion and/or mastery of all requirements, including customer service student program modules 1 and 2.
Minimum of 150 documented hours on-the-job experience.

a594571c-8f7e-4566-a562-90df8e849c6d.description: Earners of this badge will be provided with the foundational skills and knowledge for working with students with disabilities and at multiple ability levels through coursework that addresses diverse learning and learning strategies, differentiated instruction, history of special education. As students continue to be taught in more fully inclusive educational settings, now more than ever before, all teachers must have an understanding of how to effectively teach and educate all learners.
a594571c-8f7e-4566-a562-90df8e849c6d.name: Learning to Work with Students with Special Needs: A Special Education Badge

alignments.name: Courses are aligned to the CEC (Council for Exceptional Children) Teaching Preparation Standards.

badge_template_activities.title: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution, with a minimum GPA of 3.0. for Option A;  two graduate courses either Track 1-ED 670 and ED 675 or Track two ED 675 and ED 677 to earn the badge.
Teacher certification for Option B, take and pass with a B or better grade, two graduate courses either Track 1-ED 670 and ED 675 or Track two ED 675 and ED 677 to earn the badge.

4df9472c-b52c-4196-93f5-ab239697b658.description: Earners of the Women's Leadership Certificate have developed leadership skills related to collaboration and teamwork, creative and critical thinking, relationships, communication, goal setting, self development, inclusion, and equity. They have worked individually, with mentors, and in organizations to develop and strengthen their leadership skills.
4df9472c-b52c-4196-93f5-ab239697b658.name: Women's Leadership Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Sustained participation in at least 1 registered student organization - attendance at a minimum of 5 organization meetings and/or a position on a student organization's e-board.
Participation in at least 3 service learning experiences (in addition to AOK1 required hours).

Participation in at least 2 additional practical applications including internships, academic competitions, conferences, employer site visits, developing your own event and/or other professional development or political action activities.
Badge earner must submit an essay (minimum 2 pages) reflecting on these experiences as well as describing leadership competencies they gained in the process.

10fb3c5f-8a3e-4336-af4b-4d066233f065.description: Earners of the Academic Technology Proficiency level 2 badge have developed skills in Admin level support of Brightspace. These skills include: Copying content, opening courses, using communication tools and handling gradebook questions efficiently. Earners of this badge will also be able to host training demonstrations for ePortfolio in classrooms.
10fb3c5f-8a3e-4336-af4b-4d066233f065.name: Academic Technology Proficiency Level II

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates a full understanding departmental and office processes and procedures.
Minimum of at least 300 documented hours of work experience (or 2 completed semesters).
Display proficiency with copying content, opening courses, using communication tools and handling gradebook questions efficiently under observation 2 times.
Earners will be able to demonstrate in detail how to access and use ePortofio effectively.

166c83ce-16a9-45c8-a129-2a34d428aab0.description: Earners of the Applied Statistics Badge get ample training opportunities in data analysis, statistical model, and statistical programming through data examples and problem solving. Badge earners are capable of performing essential tasks (e.g., data mining and data visualization) in data-driven industries such as finance, business, marketing, and pharmaceuticals. They are also equipped with skill sets to pursue research in environment, health, economics, sports analytics, politics, social science
166c83ce-16a9-45c8-a129-2a34d428aab0.name: Applied Statistics Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Completes Intro to Statistics and two of our three 200-level statistics courses (MAT 218, 222, 225). For those who already have Intro to Statistics, they would only need two of the three 200-level statistics courses (MAT 218, 222, 225). 200-level courses are: Applied Regression Models, Applied Multivariable Statistical Methods, and Bayesian Statistics and Modeling.

02e4c557-c536-4e59-a839-878d96883c1c.description: Earners of the Blueprint Reading badge have completed the Introduction to Blueprint Reading, Intermediate Blueprint Reading, and Advanced Blueprint Reading courses through Pace University's Continuing Education. They developed the skills needed to read and understand advanced construction drawings. They are competent in skills such as reading different types of construction drawings and understanding architectural and engineering scales, dimension and area drawings.
02e4c557-c536-4e59-a839-878d96883c1c.name: Blueprint Reading Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to Blueprint Reading course.
Complete the Intermediate Blueprint Reading course.
Complete the Advanced Blueprint Reading course.

skills.name: Electrical And Plumbing Systems Of The Buildings

1becc479-f519-46a8-a408-abad4de0a8b0.description: This badge is for staff only. Earners of this badge will understand and recognize the importance of customer service. They will know how to model best practices in customer service to promote student success.
1becc479-f519-46a8-a408-abad4de0a8b0.name: Customer Service Badge (Enrollment Management)

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of 2 synchronous in-person or virtual modules. Module 1: Services Values (120 min.); and Module 2: The Service Mindset (90 min.) Key learning includes: Defining and Understanding the Importance of Customer Service; Pace's 5 Core Service Standard Values in Action; The Platinum Rule Rules; The Service Mindset; Taking the Heat Model; Tips for Immediate Impact; Understanding our Customers

2af99af1-c9cb-49f3-a544-290f283da86d.description: Earners of the Essential Workplace Skills badge have developed basic skills needed to function effectively in the modern workplace. They have demonstrated competence in time management, team building and problem solving, as well as basic leadership skills.
2af99af1-c9cb-49f3-a544-290f283da86d.name: Essential Workplace Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners must successfully complete at least three 20-hour Career Skills Development courses that qualify towards this badge.  Qualifying courses are: Leadership Workshop; Problem Solving and Decision Making; Team Work and Team Building; Time Management; Cross Cultural Communication in the Workplace; Developing an Entrepreneurial Mindset; New Approaches to Digital Marketing and Social Media

9b2dcada-7a43-489c-8c55-99ff0d2691f4.description: Designed as a credit- bearing badge for students who wish to demonstrate knowledge and competencies in the areas of immigration policy, US immigration law (both historic and regarding pending legislation), international law regarding immigrants and migrants, and asylee and refugee policy in the United States and elsewhere.
9b2dcada-7a43-489c-8c55-99ff0d2691f4.name: Immigration Advocacy & Policy Badge

badge_template_activities.title: • POL 247 International Law and Human
• SOC 227 Border Crossing: Immigration & American Society
• Choose from list of Specific Courses
• Completion of an “e-portfolio” asynchronously and in consultation with professors.

eae0a814-b94c-4231-9f42-7d2a2de242b6.description: Earners of the IT Computer Lab Student Consultant Proficiency II (Level 2) badge have developed more mid-to-advanced tech support/troubleshooting expertise and knowledge of University and departmental systems, as well as coaching/training skills and have been applying them on the job consistently by helping to support/train/coach other junior-level IT Computer Lab Consultants.
eae0a814-b94c-4231-9f42-7d2a2de242b6.name: IT Computer Lab Student Consultant Proficiency II

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate completion and/or mastery of all requirements, including customer service student program module 3
Minimum of 300 documented hours of on-the-job experience, including performing a minimum of 100 hours of documented senior-level support tasks
IT Computer Lab Student Consultant Proficiency I

skills.name: Coaching/Training/Support of Junior-Level IT Computer Lab Consultants

0a1928f6-0bef-43b9-b548-9afc877c6940.description: The badge earner will be able to work with UNIX/LINUX basic commands and editors, understand how to write and execute Unix/Linux Shell Scripts, to demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Project by creating project-based schedules and budgets. Badge holders will be eligible to take the Microsoft Office User exam for Excel and perform statistical analysis and Web 3.0 tools including wikis and blogs.
0a1928f6-0bef-43b9-b548-9afc877c6940.name: IT Skills

alignments.name: Completion Grade
alignments.description: Must successfully complete each of the courses in this badge with a grade of a C or higher

badge_template_activities.title: Complete CS199H Unix Fundamentals
Complete CIS102N Introduction to Project Management
Complete CIS122 Advanced Spreadsheet Skills
Complete CIS133 Social Media
Telecom Essentials

96c6acfc-565f-44f4-98fe-95e3dcf1df09.description: Earners of the Law IT Help Desk Student Technician Proficiency I badge have developed entry-level skills and competence in customer service, proper phone etiquette, basic troubleshooting techniques. They are familiar with help desk ticketing tasks, printer support, familiarity navigating Windows, Mac, and mobile operating systems, assisting with wireless & email account setups, remote assistance technologies, help desk ticket creation/lookup/management/resolution, proper issue escalation & more
96c6acfc-565f-44f4-98fe-95e3dcf1df09.name: Law IT Help Desk Student Technician Proficiency I

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Demonstrate completion and/or mastery of all requirements including: entry-level skills and competence in customer service, proper phone etiquette, basic troubleshooting techniques, Help Desk ticketing tasks (ticket creation/lookup/management/resolution/proper issue escalation), printer support, wireless and email account setups, remote assistance technologies, navigating Windows, Mac, and mobile operating systems 2. Minimum of 150 documented hours on-the-job experience.

1d120238-60ae-4f2f-9280-d3f95d48fe34.description: Earners of the Law IT Help Desk Proficiency II badge have developed more mid-to-advanced troubleshooting expertise and knowledge of University and departmental systems. Can work unsupervised and self-assign work tickets; troubleshoot/resolve issues with operating system, hardware, peripherals (e.g., printers), and PC imaging; demonstrate awareness of other ITS departments and roles and can escalate to the correct department if needed; train junior staff.
1d120238-60ae-4f2f-9280-d3f95d48fe34.name: Law IT Help Desk Student Technician Proficiency II

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Earned Law IT Help Desk Student Technician Proficiency 1 badge 2. Minimum of 20 Windows PCs fully imaged and prepped without errors (A full-time technician does not have to redo any item of the checklist) 3. Successfully resolved software/hardware issues on field calls without supervision 4. Must have accumulated at least 300 hours (2 semesters) of work experience

2cb4d250-c359-48e1-b787-1bb9371413ba.description: Earners have developed expertise in the literacy education field with competencies in children's and adolescents' multicultural literature, digital composing for storytelling, media production formats for teaching and learning, reading strategies and writing development. Teachers will have strengthened their knowledge of literacy and technology use for teaching and learning. Coaching and mentoring approaches for specialists are enriched.
2cb4d250-c359-48e1-b787-1bb9371413ba.name: Literacy Enrichment: Reading, Writing, & Digital Technology

alignments.name: International Literacy Association's Standards for Reading Professionals 2017; Reading/Literacy Specialist
alignments.description: #2: curriculum and instruction; #3: assessment and evaluation; #4: diversity and equity; #5: learners and literacy environment through use of print and digital technologies to support knowledge of multicultural literature.

badge_template_activities.title: ED 754 Literature and Digital Storytelling
ED 758: Instructional Approaches for Teaching Writing, Digital Composing, & Media Production

5eec8d4d-2f7f-4b76-bd8b-c6d815b2d5ac.description: The badge earner will demonstrate the knowledge of and the ability to configure organizational software defined networks using Vmware, Microsoft, or Amazon virtualization software. The earner will demonstrate the ability to design, install, and maintain both a software defined network, and a cloud computing method of delivering information over a secure environment not reliant on where in the world the individual is located. (Requires IT Core)
5eec8d4d-2f7f-4b76-bd8b-c6d815b2d5ac.name: Networking Technologies

alignments.name: Completion Grade
alignments.description: Must successfully complete each of the courses in this badge with a grade of a C or higher

badge_template_activities.title: Complete CIT223 Introduction to Software Defined Networking and Virtualization
Complete CIT224 Cloud Computing
Complete  CIT252 Overview of Network and Internet Security
Telecom Core
IT Core

c5c56cdc-7376-4820-aacb-9b5a554f199b.description: Earners of the Psychology for the Global Workplace badge have developed basic skills and knowledge to use psychology effectively in the global workplace. They have demonstrated competence in learning effectively and applying psychological awareness to various workplace situations such as working with children, working in a multi-cultural environment, starting a new business and working with customers.
c5c56cdc-7376-4820-aacb-9b5a554f199b.name: Psychology for the Global Workplace

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners must successfully complete at least three 20-hour Career Skills Development courses that qualify towards this badge.  Qualifying courses are: Child Psychology and Development, Multicultural Psychology, Psychology in the Workplace, Consumer Behavior, Developing an Entrepreneurial Mindset: First Steps towards Success, Learning How to Learn.

5bed79f0-7274-4f3a-877d-905707046c59.description: Ed Media Technical Skills Badge (Level II) Earners of this badge can work autonomously and troubleshoot/resolve issues, while still providing excellent customer service. They possess problem-solving skills and can present flexible solutions during unexpected system outages. They have become a reliable resource to their peers and can train, teach, and coach junior staff. They have demonstrated awareness of other ITS departments and roles and can escalate to the correct department if needed.
5bed79f0-7274-4f3a-877d-905707046c59.name: Technical Skills Badge (Ed Media)

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate completion and/or mastery of all requirements, including customer service student program module 3
Minimum of 300 documented hours of on-the-job experience within 2 completed semesters, including a minimum of 100 hours of documented senior-level support tasks.
Customer Service Badge (Ed Media)

skills.name: Coaching/Training/and Support of Junior-Level Ed Media Student Assistants

579e9be9-e205-4a30-9fde-70d3466a950b.description: Earners of the Workplace Communication Skills badge have developed essential skills needed to communicate effectively at work. They have demonstrated competence in verbal and written skills including giving presentations, communicating across cultures and communicating effectively with customers.
579e9be9-e205-4a30-9fde-70d3466a950b.name: Workplace Communication Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners must successfully complete at least three 20-hour Career Skills Development courses that qualify towards this badge.  Qualifying courses are: Professional Writing Skills, Cross-Cultural Communication in the Workplace, Professional Presentation Skills, Communicating Effectively with Customers
